steps.stepDescription: Combine the 680 grams of ground beef with the 1 tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce, 0.5 teaspoon of onion powder, 0.5 teaspoon of garlic powder, 1 teaspoon of salt, and 0.25 teaspoon of black pepper. Mix **gently** with your hands until just combined. Overmixing will make the burgers tough.

Divide the mixture into 4 equal portions and form into patties about 2 centimeters thick. Make a small indentation in the center of each patty with your thumb to prevent them from puffing up while cooking.
Heat a skillet or grill to medium-high heat. Cook the patties for 3-5 minutes per side for medium doneness, or until the internal temperature reaches 71 degrees.
During the last minute of cooking, place 1 piece of American cheese on each patty. Cover the grill or skillet briefly to ensure the cheese melts nicely.

Toast the 4 pieces of buns cut-side down on the grill or a dry skillet for about 30 seconds. To assemble, spread 1 tablespoon of mayonnaise on both halves of the bun. Place the cheeseburger patty on the bottom bun, top with some of the 1 cup of dill pickle chips, and cap with the top bun.

ingredients.name: Taco Shells or Tortillas (Corn or Flour)
Shredded Cheddar Cheese or Mexican Blend

steps.stepDescription: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the ground beef and cook, breaking it up with a spoon, until fully browned and no longer pink.
Drain any excess grease from the skillet and return the meat to the heat.
Stir in the chili powder, cumin, oregano, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. Cook for 1 minute, allowing the spices to toast.

Add the tomato paste and water. Stir well to coat the meat. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce heat to low and cook until the sauce has thickened and the liquid is mostly absorbed (the meat should still be moist, not dry).
While the meat simmers, warm the taco shells or tortillas according to package directions.
Spoon the seasoned taco meat into the shells or tortillas. Top with shredded lettuce, cheese, diced tomatoes, and a dollop of sour cream or yogurt (optional). Serve immediately.
Activate the yeast by mixing it with warm water and a pinch of sugar (not listed in ingredients, but assumed for yeast activation) in a bowl. Let it sit for 5-10 minutes until foamy.
In a large bowl, combine the flour and salt. Pour in the yeast mixture and the 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Mix until a shaggy dough forms.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 8-10 minutes until smooth and elastic. Place in a greased bowl, cover, and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size.

Preheat your oven to the highest temperature (usually 250°C/480°F) and place a pizza stone or baking sheet inside to heat up. Punch down the dough, divide it into two balls (for two medium pizzas), and let them rest for 10 minutes.

Stretch or roll one dough ball into a 12-inch circle. Transfer it to a floured pizza peel or parchment paper. Spread half the crushed tomatoes evenly, top with half the torn mozzarella, and drizzle with a little olive oil and a pinch of pepper.
Bake the pizza for 12-15 minutes until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly. Once out of the oven, garnish immediately with fresh basil leaves. Slice and serve.
Cut the chicken breast into 1-inch strips. In a bowl, toss the chicken with olive oil, smoked paprika, garlic powder, and a pinch of salt until well coated.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the seasoned chicken strips and cook for 5-7 minutes, turning occasionally, until they are golden brown and fully cooked through (internal temperature of 74°C/165°F).

While the chicken is still hot, remove it from the heat and transfer it to a clean bowl. Pour the ranch dressing and hot sauce over the chicken. Toss until every piece is coated in the spicy ranch mixture.
Lay out one tortilla. Spread a thin layer of shredded lettuce down the center, followed by a quarter of the shredded cheddar cheese. This forms the base of the wrap.
Place a quarter of the spicy ranch chicken mixture over the cheese and lettuce. Be careful not to overfill the wrap.
To wrap, fold in the two sides of the tortilla over the filling, then tightly roll the wrap from the bottom up. Slice the finished wrap in half diagonally and serve immediately.
Crack the eggs into a bowl. Add salt and pepper. Whisk vigorously until the yolks and whites are fully combined and slightly frothy, but avoid incorporating too much air.
Heat a non-stick skillet (about 8 inches) over medium heat. Add the butter and swirl it around until it melts, foams up, and then subsides, becoming a clear, nutty color.

Pour the egg mixture into the hot skillet. Let the eggs set for about 10 seconds. Then, using a fork or rubber spatula, stir the eggs constantly and rapidly, tilting the pan, until the bottom is set but the top is still moist and creamy.
Stop stirring and let the omelette cook undisturbed for another 30 seconds to fully set the bottom. Sprinkle the chopped chives over the center third of the omelette.

Tilt the pan, and using a spatula, fold one side of the omelette about a third of the way over the center. Gently roll the omelette out of the pan and onto a plate, seam-side down, to create a neat torpedo shape. Serve immediately.

request.recipeName: Classic Garlic and Olive Oil Spaghetti (Aglio e Olio)

steps.stepDescription: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Salt the water (it should be as salty as sea water). Add the spaghetti and cook according to package instructions until al dente. Reserve about 1 cup of the pasta cooking water.

While the pasta is cooking, thinly slice the garlic. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add 0.75 cup of extra virgin olive oil. Add the sliced garlic and 1 teaspoon of red pepper flakes to the skillet.

Sauté the garlic until golden and fragrant, about 2-3 minutes. **Be careful not to burn it**, otherwise it will become bitter. Add 0.5 cup of the reserved pasta cooking water to the skillet. Bring to a simmer.

Drain the cooked pasta (do not rinse) and immediately transfer it to the skillet with the garlic sauce. Add the remaining 4 tablespoons of chopped fresh parsley. Quickly mix and toss the pan to coat all the pasta with the sauce.
Add a little more reserved pasta water if necessary to adjust the consistency of the sauce. Taste and add 1 pinch of black pepper and additional salt if needed. Serve immediately while hot.
Cut the 500 grams of chicken breast into 1-inch cubes. In a bowl, toss the chicken with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, 0.5 teaspoon of salt, 1 teaspoon of garlic powder, and 1 pinch of black pepper.

Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the seasoned chicken and cook for 6-8 minutes, turning occasionally, until golden brown and fully cooked through.
While the chicken cooks, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the 350 grams of fettuccine and cook until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of the cooking water.

Reduce the heat on the skillet (with the chicken) to low. Pour in the 250 milliliters of heavy cream and 0.5 cup of basil pesto. Stir well until combined. Let the sauce simmer gently for 2 minutes to thicken slightly.

Add the drained pasta to the creamy pesto sauce and toss to coat. Stir in the 0.5 cup of grated Parmesan cheese and about 0.25 cup of the reserved pasta water. Add more water if needed to reach your desired consistency. Serve immediately.
Grate both the Cheddar and Monterey Jack cheeses and mix them together in a small bowl. Grating ensures even melting.

Spread the butter evenly on one side of each slice of bread. This is the side that will touch the pan. Optionally, spread a thin layer of mayonnaise on the opposite side (the inside) of one slice for extra flavor.
Place one slice of bread (butter-side down) in a non-stick skillet over medium-low heat. Sprinkle the mixed cheese evenly over the bread, then add a pinch of salt.
Top with the second slice of bread (butter-side up). Cook for 3 to 4 minutes until the bottom slice is golden brown and the cheese is starting to melt.

Carefully flip the sandwich using a spatula. Cook for another 3 to 4 minutes until the second side is golden brown and the cheese is fully melted and oozy. If the outside browns too quickly, lower the heat.
Remove from the skillet, slice diagonally, and serve immediately.

request.recipeName: Perfect Pan-Seared Ribeye Steak with Garlic Herb Butter

steps.stepDescription: Pat the steaks completely dry with paper towels. Season generously on all sides with kosher salt and black pepper. Let the steaks sit at room temperature for 30 minutes before cooking.

Heat the vegetable oil in a cast-iron skillet over high heat until it begins to shimmer and smoke slightly. Carefully place the seasoned steaks into the hot pan. Sear for 3 to 4 minutes until a deep, dark brown crust has formed.

Flip the steaks. Reduce the heat to medium. Add the butter, smashed garlic cloves, and thyme sprigs to the pan. Tilt the pan slightly and use a large spoon to baste the melted herb butter over the steaks continuously for 1 to 2 minutes, or until the desired internal temperature is reached (e.g., 130°F for medium-rare).

Remove the steaks from the pan and place them on a cutting board. Pour the remaining herb butter from the pan over the steaks. Let them rest for 5 to 10 minutes to allow the juices to redistribute before slicing and serving.

Marinate the chicken: In a large bowl, mix the chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric powder, and the marinade garam masala. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 4 hours.
Cook the chicken: Grill, bake, or pan-fry the marinated chicken until fully cooked and slightly charred on the edges. Set aside.

Prepare the sauce base: In a large pot, melt half of the butter. Add the tomato puree and cook until the oil separates (about 10 minutes). Add 1/2 cup of water, simmer, then blend the sauce until completely smooth. Strain the blended sauce back into the pot.
Finish the sauce: Add the remaining butter, sugar, and the remaining garam masala (if desired) to the strained sauce. Stir well. Add the cooked chicken pieces and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve: Stir in the heavy cream and crush the Kasuri Methi between your palms before adding it. Heat through but do not boil. Serve immediately with rice or naan bread.
Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sauté until softened, about 5-7 minutes. Add minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute more.
Stir in the canned diced tomatoes, broth, dried basil, salt, and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Carefully transfer the soup to a blender or use an immersion blender to blend the soup until smooth. Return the soup to the pot.
Stir in the heavy cream and heat through for 2-3 minutes, but do not boil. Serve hot, optionally garnished with fresh basil or croutons.
